metadata.title: PTA Prompt and Requirements Package (Rev 2)
metadata.purpose: Guide an LLM (e.g., GitHub Copilot) to fully populate a VA Privacy Threshold Agreement (PTA) for the Package Manager (PacMan) system, maximizing artifact extraction, minimizing system steward input, and ensuring complete output with embedded initiator signature (AMBoserup).
metadata.usage: Upload or paste this JSON into the LLM interface. The LLM will request Confluence and GitHub URLs, extract data, use defaults/examples for missing data, and generate a complete PTA in .txt format.
sources: System Architecture Confluence page (https://confluence.devops.va.gov/display/VAExternal/2993_Package+Manager+Architecture or PDF)
System steward input (only for critical missing data)
metadata.wip_status: Work in Progress, iterative update to address redundant prompts and incomplete output

instructions.overview: You are an LLM (e.g., GitHub Copilot) tasked with generating a complete Privacy Threshold Agreement (PTA) for the Package Manager (PacMan) system, adhering to the FY25 Standard PTA Template. Extract data from provided artifacts (Confluence, GitHub, partial PTA draft) first, use VBMSC PTA examples or defaults for missing data, and prompt the system steward only for critical gaps. The steward is the weakest link, so minimize their input. Complete all sections, embedding the initiator’s signature (AMBoserup).

guardrails.description: Extract all possible data from Confluence (https://confluence.devops.va.gov/display/VAExternal/2993_Package+Manager+Architecture), GitHub (https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-pacman-service), and the partial PTA draft before prompting the steward. Check Confluence for system overview, architecture, connections, and contacts; GitHub for README, documentation, and data models; and the draft for pre-filled fields.

For missing data, use VBMSC PTA examples (e.g., contacts, SORN details) or reasonable defaults (e.g., 'Moderate' for PII impact level). Mark these as 'place holder (review required)' and include review instructions in the output.

Batch prompts for missing data into a single request per section, prioritizing critical fields (e.g., system name, contacts). Avoid redundant confirmations if data is in artifacts or defaults are applicable.
Generate a full PTA with all sections (1–3, Review, Signatures) in .txt format, even if some fields are placeholders. Do not stop unless critical data (e.g., system name) is absent.

Prompts must include a VBMSC PTA example, source suggestion (e.g., 'Check Confluence team contacts'), and concise instructions. Output includes a review checklist for placeholders and signature coordination.

initiation.description: Prompt the system steward for artifacts if not already provided. Use the existing URLs if accessible.

prompts.text: Please confirm or provide the URL to the System Architecture Confluence page (provided: https://confluence.devops.va.gov/display/VAExternal/2993_Package+Manager+Architecture) or upload a PDF export.
prompts.validation: If inaccessible, prompt: 'The Confluence URL is invalid or inaccessible. Please provide a valid URL or upload a PDF export (e.g., Package_Manager_Architecture.pdf).'

prompts.text: Please confirm or provide the URL to the system’s GitHub repository (provided: https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-pacman-service).
prompts.validation: If invalid, prompt: 'The GitHub URL is invalid. Please provide a valid repository URL (e.g., https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va-system-repo).'

prompts.text: Do you have additional documentation (e.g., architecture diagrams, README, previous PTAs)? If yes, provide URLs or upload files (e.g., https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/bip-pacman-service/blob/main/README.md).

process_flow.description: Extract data from Confluence, GitHub, and the partial PTA draft (PTA_Package_Manager_Complete (REV1).txt). Use Confluence for system details, contacts, and connections; GitHub for tech stack, data models, and documentation; and the draft for pre-filled fields.
For missing data, use VBMSC PTA examples or defaults (e.g., 'Moderate' for PII impact, VBMSC contacts for placeholders). Mark as 'place holder (review required)' and note in the review checklist.
Prompt the steward for critical missing data (e.g., contacts, PIA approval date) in a single, batched request per section, using concise prompts with examples.
Generate a complete PTA in .txt format, including all sections, the initiator’s signature (AMBoserup), and a review checklist for placeholders and signatures.

input_guidelines.validation: Ensure URLs are accessible and files are machine-readable. Use VA-approved environments for sensitive data (e.g., PII, PHI).
input_guidelines.prompt_handling: Batch prompts into one request per section. Include VBMSC PTA examples and source suggestions (e.g., 'Check GitHub README').

output_format.description: Generate a .txt file with the complete PTA, structured per the FY25 Standard PTA Template. Include all sections (1–3, Review, Signatures), with the initiator’s signature (AMBoserup) and placeholders for other signatures. Append a review checklist.
output_format.example_structure:
# Privacy Threshold Agreement (PTA)
## 1 - Information System and Project Information
1.1 Date: [Filled]
...
## Approval Signatures
Initiator: AMBoserup
...
## Review Checklist
- Verify placeholders (e.g., contacts)
- Coordinate signatures

troubleshooting.solution: Prompt for PDF exports or GitHub files (e.g., README.md).
Use VBMSC PTA examples or defaults, mark as 'place holder (review required)', and list in the review checklist.
Ensure all sections are generated, using placeholders if necessary. Cross-check with the FY25 template.

fields.name: Date PTA Submitted to PIA Support for Review
fields.prompt: Confirm the PTA submission date (default: 2025-05-21, e.g., 4/12/2025).

fields.name: Name of the IT System or Project
fields.prompt: Confirm the system name (default: Package Manager (PacMan), e.g., VBMS Correspondence). Check Confluence overview.

fields.name: Former System Name (from Last PTA)
fields.prompt: Confirm the former system name (default: N/A).

fields.name: eMASS ID #
fields.prompt: Confirm the eMASS ID (default: 2061, e.g., 2066). Check Confluence or eMASS records.

fields.name: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Usage
fields.prompt: Confirm if the system uses AI (default: False). Check Confluence architecture or GitHub code.

fields.name: VA Administration/Offices Processing the PTA
fields.prompt: Confirm the VA administration (default: VBA). Options: VHA, VBA, NCA, VACO.

fields.name: Data Owners in This System
fields.prompt: Confirm data owners (default: VBA: List of VBA Offices). Specify offices if known.

fields.name: Program Office
fields.prompt: Confirm the program office (default: Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) Product, e.g., Benefits, Appeals, and Memorials Program).

fields.name: System Ownership/Control
fields.prompt: Confirm the ownership model (default: VA Owned and VA Operated). Options: VA Partnership, VA Owned and VA Operated, VA Owned and non-VA Operated, VA Controlled / non-VA Owned and Operated.

fields.name: IT System and Project Contacts
fields.prompt: Provide contact details for Privacy Officer, ISSO, ISO, and Data Owner (e.g., Privacy Officer: Marvis Harvey, Marvis.Harvey@va.gov, 314-964-5469). Check Confluence team contacts or VA directory. Default: place holder (review required).

fields.name: Status of IT System and Project
fields.prompt: Confirm status (default: Existing with PIA) and provide PIA approval date (e.g., 6/1/2022). Options: New, Existing without PIA, Existing with PIA, Decommissioned, Non-operational.

fields.name: System Categorization
fields.prompt: Confirm categorization (default: Minor, augmenting VBMS, eMASS ID 1728). Provide major system details if different.

fields.name: Type of Model Used
fields.prompt: Confirm the service model (default: Not Applicable). Options: SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, DaaS, MBaaS, ITMaaS, Not Applicable.

fields.name: Type of Information Contained
fields.prompt: Confirm if VA data is processed (default: Yes).

fields.name: PII Confidentiality Impact Level
fields.prompt: Confirm the PII impact level (default: Moderate). Options: Low, Moderate, High.

requirements.condition: Skip if new PTA or decommissioned

fields.name: Annual Validation Status
fields.description: Major changes or PIA update status.

example.status: No major changes but PIA needs update

fields.prompt: Confirm validation status (default: No major changes). Options: Major changes, No major changes, No major changes but PIA needs update. Provide change details if applicable.

fields.name: System Description
fields.default: The Package Manager (PacMan) provides the ability to create “packages” of documents for Veterans or third-party representatives. Packages are created in PacMan and sent for distribution by the CBCM print vendor, supporting the Veterans Benefits Management System (VBMS) Product. PacMan acts as a middleman between Core (Veteran selection) and external print vendors, allowing users to manage packages, monitor distribution statuses, and handle workflow events.
fields.example: VBMS Correspondence is a component of the Veteran Benefit Management System (VBMS) that creates letters and other communications sent to Veterans...
fields.prompt: Confirm the system description (default provided). Edit if needed, referencing Confluence overview or GitHub README.

fields.name: Technologies Employed
fields.prompt: Confirm technologies (default: Cloud Computing, Web Portal Internal, REST APIs, RHEL 7.x). Options: Cloud Computing, Web Portal Internal, Web Portal External, SharePoint, Closed Circuit TV, Social Media, Mobile Devices/Applications, Applications, Robotic Process Automation, Other, Not Applicable.

fields.name: Data Stored in the Cloud
fields.prompt: Confirm if data is stored in the cloud (default: True).

fields.name: Cloud Service Provider Details
fields.prompt: Confirm cloud provider details (default: VAEC AWS Government, Contract # NNG15SD22B VA118-17-F-2284). Provide actual contract number if known.

fields.name: Collection of Individual Information
fields.prompt: Confirm if individual information is collected (default: True).

fields.name: PII/PHI Data Collected
fields.prompt: Confirm PII/PHI data elements (default: Veterans: Claimant Name, SSN, etc.). Check Confluence data types or GitHub data models.

fields.name: Retrieval by Unique Identifier
fields.description: Whether data is retrieved by unique identifier.
fields.prompt: Confirm if data is retrieved by unique identifier (default: True, e.g., SSN).

fields.name: Existing SORN

sorn_details.title: Compensation, Pension, Education, and Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment Records-VA

fields.prompt: Confirm if a SORN exists (default: True, placeholder details). Provide SORN number, title, and link (e.g., 58VA21, Compensation Records). Check VA OPRM site.

fields.name: Direct Collection from Individuals
fields.description: Whether data is collected directly from individuals.
fields.prompt: Confirm if data is collected directly from individuals (default: False).

fields.name: SSN Collection
fields.prompt: Confirm if SSNs are collected (default: True, alternative: ICN, EDIPI).

fields.name: SSN Privacy Enhancing Technologies
fields.prompt: Confirm SSN protection technologies (default: Encrypted, Only available to certain users). Options: Encrypted, Anonymized, Truncated, Partial form, Hidden from all users, Only available to certain users, Not applicable.

fields.name: Internal PII Sharing
fields.prompt: Confirm if PII is shared internally (default: True).

fields.name: Internal Components Table

example.component_name: Database names not identified in VBMS application interconnection

fields.prompt: Provide component names sharing PII (default: placeholder). Confirm data elements (e.g., Claimant Name, SSN). Check Confluence components or GitHub data models.

fields.name: Internal VA Sharing

example.transmission_method: Specific signing, encryption, and SAML injection techniques

fields.prompt: Confirm internal systems and transmission method (default: VBMS Core, SAML encryption). Provide details if different.

fields.name: External PII/PHI Sharing
fields.prompt: Confirm if PII/PHI is shared externally (default: False).

fields.name: External Data Sharing Table
fields.prompt: Provide external systems sharing PII/PHI (default: N/A). Include connection and agreement types if applicable.

requirements.note: Completed by PIA Support, but include defaults for steward review.

fields.name: Date Reviewed by VA PIA Support Analyst
fields.prompt: Provide the review date, if known (e.g., 4/17/2025). Default: place holder (review required).

fields.name: Name of VA PIA Support Analyst
fields.prompt: Provide the analyst’s name, if known (e.g., Bertha Okere-Ford). Default: place holder (review required).

fields.name: VA PIA Support Analyst Signature
fields.prompt: Leave blank for PIA Support.

fields.name: Determination

default.comments: System processes PII, requires PIA update (place holder (review required))

fields.prompt: Confirm privacy sensitivity (default: True, PIA update needed). Provide comments if known.

fields.name: PIA Support Analyst Comments
fields.default: The Package Manager (PacMan) is a privacy-sensitive system processing PII for Veterans and dependents. A PIA update is required (place holder (review required)).
fields.example: The VBMS Correspondence is a privacy sensitive system that collects, maintains, and/or processes Personally Identifiable Information on Veterans and/or dependents...
fields.prompt: Provide analyst comments, if known (e.g., PII processing details). Default: placeholder (review required).

fields.name: Approval Signatures
fields.prompt: Provide signatures for Privacy Officer, ISSO, and ISO (e.g., Privacy Officer: Digitally signed by Marvis Harvey). Initiator signature (AMBoserup) is included. Coordinate with contacts via VA directory.

review_checklist: Verify all 'place holder (review required)' fields (e.g., contacts, SORN details) using Confluence, GitHub, or VA records.
Confirm PII/PHI data elements are consistent across tables (3.4.1, 3.9a.1, 3.9b).
Coordinate signatures for Privacy Officer, ISSO, and ISO via VA directory.
Submit to VA PIA Support (piasupport@va.gov) with signed PDF, ensuring analyst signature is included.
